availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Timber-clad steamboat on the Ohio River at Evansville, Indiana. Built in Paducah, Kentucky. Owned in the state of Illinois. Employed as a police boat on the Ohio River by the U.S. government until August 1861. Seized by James M. Irwin at Cairo, Illinois, on August 15, 1861. Carried Confederate troops to Hickman, Kentucky, and Columbus, Kentucky, in September 1861.

ab.bibl:
Myron J. Smith, The Timberclads in the Civil War: The Lexington, Conestoga, and Tyler on the Western Waters (Jefferson, North Carolina: McFarland & Company, Inc., 2008), 85.
KYR-0001-019-0115.
